thread.section_title: Arsenal open up vote for the most depressing Player of the Month award of the season – Metro
thread.title: Arsenal open up vote for the most depressing Player of the Month award of the season
thread.title_full: Arsenal open up vote for the most depressing Player of the Month award of the season

author: Simon Rice
title: Arsenal open up vote for the most depressing Player of the Month award of the season
text:
Arsenal had to caveat their latest Player of the Month vote by conceding that March had been a ‘trying month’. 
They pushed on regardless and offered up three options for the gong.
But oh my, was it depressing.
Let’s have a quick recap of the month (Arsenal fans, you might want to skip the next couple of paragraphs). The Gunners played four games, lost three and won one.
It started with a 3-1 defeat to Liverpool and was followed by an utter humiliation by Bayern Munich who won 5-1 at the Emirates in the Champions League.
Arsene Wenger during his side’s defeat to Bayern which saw Arsenal crash out of the Champions League 10-2 on aggregate (Getty) The solitary win was a gimme against non-league Lincoln. After that Arsene Wenger’s side got back to losing ways, going down 3-1 to West Brom.
So who were the ‘stars’ of that sorry mess?
Wantaway striker Alexis Sanchez is credited because he ‘scored against Lincoln City and West Brom, and also claimed an assist for Danny Welbeck.’
Alexis Sanchez at the Hawthorns (Getty) Theo Walcott apparently ‘caught the eye’ (but not the eye of England manager Gareth Southgate though, who thought James Ward-Prowse would be more of a threat against Lithuania).
Theo Walcott scored against Bayern (Getty) Granit Xhaka meanwhile ‘has been in good form and set up Alexis’ goal’ in the game against West Brom. Arsenal then ask of the reckless tackler: ‘Has he done enough to get your vote?’
Granit Xhaka: Not amazing form, not great form, just ‘good’ form (Getty) From the reaction on Twitter, it doesn’t seem as though any of the shortlisted trio have done enough so a few other options were put forward.
@Arsenal ARE YOU HAVING A LAUGH!!!! THE BURGER MAN OUTSIDE NORTHBANK IS MY CHOICE!
— HighburyScott (@HighburyScott) March 23, 2017 
@Arsenal none of the they have been a disgrace give it to the womens team more deserving
— Breathnach (@y2jerikool) March 23, 2017 
@Arsenal Nicklas Bendtner
— Katy (@KatyGooner) March 23, 2017 
@Arsenal Claude
— ㅤ (@yaanuzaj) March 23, 2017 
@Arsenal Lucas Podolski
— Najyah (@ClassicArsxnal) March 23, 2017 

And inevitably, someone replied with this.
@Arsenal Wenger out
— …. (@Will__AFC) March 23, 2017 

Tough times.
MORE: Arsenal’s Laurent Koscielny names Chelsea’s star as Premier League’s best player
